content: Home - Chair of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning - LMU MÃ¼nchen Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning Welcome to the Chair of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (Lehr - und Forschungseinheit KÃ¼nstliche Intelligenz und Maschinelles Lernen), headed by Prof. Dr. Eyke HÃ¼llermeier. Latest News 21/10/2025 Machine learning, dynamical systems, and control: Fully funded PhD and postdoc positions in Munich The DFG Research Training Group "Machine Learning and Control Theory: Exploring Synergies, Complementarities and Mutual Benefits" (METEOR) is offering 10 PhD and 2 postdoctoral positions. Applications can be submitted till November 13th. 19/09/2025 4 AIML papers including spotlight in NeurIPS 2025 In December, our group is presenting 4 papers, including a spotlight presentation at NeurIPS, the top conference in AI. 26/06/2025 New RTG âMETEORâ approved by DFG DFG approved the new Research Training Group âMachine Learning and Control Theory: Exploring Synergies for Mutual Benefits (METEOR)â, a new cooperation between LMU Munich and TUM, set to begin in spring 2026. About Us Our research interests center around methods and theoretical foundations of artificial intelligence, with a specific focus on machine learning. We are currently conducting research on supervised learning and extensions thereof, such as weakly supervised learning, ranking and preference learning, uncertainty in machine learning, Bandit algorithms, online learning, and learning on data streams, automated machine learning (AutoML), as well as applications, social and societal implications of artificial intelligence and machine learning Research Read more Publications Read more Team Read more Teaching Read more Thesis Requests Read more News / Events Read more up
